ratings.comment: If you have any interest in American history, 306 with Sharpless is one of the best decisions you could make. Lectures are interesting, minimal assignments (1 in class bluebook and 2 take home essays), grading is fair. He is also retiring soon (next semester?) so if you're looking for an elective, take one of his classes.

Had Sharpless for Politics and Film and honestly the best class I have ever taken. This one lets you write free and creative in your analysis of the films for class. Lots of political experience he uses to explain concept and ideas. Really chill guy. Pro tip, make sure to include the readings. Don't be intimidated in the amount of work on the sylab

Sharpless is one awesome guy. He loves going on tangents about zombies and stories from his travels. He also has a great grasp on history- ranging everywhere from biblical to Native American. It's definitely a class worth taking. I do recommend skimming through the texts, however, because it's a lot of reading. Either way, Sharpless is tremendous.

For his 201 class, there is a lot of reading and writing. Most of the books you just need to skim and get the main idea, and the papers are mostly two pages. Has a few attendance pop quizzes throughout the semester, so its a good idea to attend. No final exam but a final paper that was 8-10 pages that you work on progressively throughout the class.

John Sharpless is easily the best professor I have ever had at UW. I took Imagining American Politics in Hollywood Film and it is hands down the best class I have taken here. The syllabus is well put together, he gives amazing lectures , he will write a recommendation for anyone and he took us all out for beers at the end of the semester. Great guy

The class was mostly ran by the TA who was pretty hard this semester. The class was a lot of work for a 100 level class. A lot of reading and both in class and out of class essay exams. Material talked about in lectures and discussions was often times different. Lectures were very boring and attendance was unnecessary.

Sharpless is a funny guy but his lectures seem to drag on forever; about half his students fall asleep at any given time. His TA was really tough this semester and gave out a ton of bad grades. Both of them expect too much for a 100 level course. The readings also take forever and are the most boring things ever. Definitely not an easy course.

Sharpless is one of the best professors I have had at UW. His lectures are entertaining, but informative. He made me want to go to every lecture. I would take this class again, and would take any other class offered by Sharpless.

Sharpless is absolutely hilarious and honestly one of the best people I've had the privilege to know. He cares very deeply about his kids and will always be there when/if you need him. He's also very funny and adds a lot of dry humor to his lectures.  Not to mention, he's incredibly knowledgable about his subject matter. Take his class.

I'm not a history major but History 398 with Sharpless was my favorite class at UW. He's incredibly entertaining, intelligent and passionate about teaching. The reading is difficult to keep up with but it's totally worth it. TAKE HIS CLASS.
Hilarious. Best professor ever

Professor Sharpless is easily one of the best lecturers I've had at UW. He is hilarious, but also presents material that could be boring in an interesting manner. Only one midterm (in-class essay), one take-home essay, and a final. The one downside to this class is a LOT of reading. Around 200 pagesweek.

Professor Sharpless was a captivating lecturer, mostly because he had a great dry sense of humor. For some reason he loves to talk about zombies. His tests were super easy, just essay questions that we got beforehand. However we had to purchase a lot of textbooks, only two of which I actually opened. I would recommend him for sure though.
I would absolutely not recommend him to anyone. He goes off on tangents in lecture about his opinions which have nothing to do with the course material at all.

Sharpless is by far the best professor I have ever had. Not only does he make things interesting, but also he truly cares for his students. Anybody with a sense of humor will love his lectures. I recommend meeting him outside of class too, he is super resourceful!
Sharpless for president. Best professor I have had so far. Very good speaker and very intelligent.

Sharpless is the man! Very passionate and very knowledgeable about early US history. Humorous (and sometimes wacky) asides during lecture here and there help keep you awake and laughing, hopefully. As mentioned in earlier rating, he does pretend to be heavily conservative but it's mainly for humor's sake, keeps material very objective. Great prof!

This was the third class I have had with him and he is by far my favorite prof.  Yes he is funny, but he also one of the best lecturers I have ever had.  Despite his personal political leanings he kept the class very objective.  I highly recommend any of his classes.

Sharpless is one of my favorite professors at the UW. Hilarious, extremely knowledgeable, and equally critical of politicians of both parties (he isn't as conservative as he makes himself sound on the first day of class). Highly recommend a class with John, if you have a sense of humor you won't regret it.

Sharpless is great. Everything you hear about hilarious lectures is true. First entertaining power lec of my college career. Finally a conservative teacher at super liberal UW Madison that isn't afraid to speak his beliefs. Great class, take lec notes, read the books, write decent papers and you will be just fine.

Sharpless is incredible. This was my second class with him and having a capstone with him made my final year at Wisco so memorable and fun. He is hands down the best professor I've had. Hilarious and dedicated, he genuinely cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed. He also likes to take students to the Union for pitchers. Awesome guy.

Great sense of humor, as long as you don't mind that he isn't politically correct.  He understands the student mind and is very engaging.  Clearly has a good knowledge and is fond of what he teaches.  Lectures were always entertaining.  Assignments could get on the sappy side but were overall pretty easy.

Sharpless kept lectures interesting with his sense of humor. Participating/attending discussion is an easy way to get a good grade in the class. One midterm and the final was a take home essay. Highly recommend!

Sharpless is the funniest professor and always keeps lecture interesting even when pre-civil war American history gets dry. Discussions require participation and grade depends on sharing so do assignments thoroughly prior to meeting and be ready to talk. Exams are essay but given about a week in advance and final was take home

I have never had a professor I've liked more than Sharpless in my four years at UW. Lecture style with powerpoint is crisp and to the point. His humor makes lectures enjoyable everyday and you truly never know what he will say next. Great teacher, great style of teaching, great class.

What can I say? Sharpless is awesome! Definitely one of the best lecturers I've had! Exams are essay and ID, pretty straightforward, not too difficult. There's a decent amount of reading but it can be skimmed.

Sharpless is a great professor. I was in a power lecture for his class and he keeps your interest with funny stories but also relates it to the topics. He is a really funny guy. His exams for my class were essays but given weeks in advance so we had time to prepare.
He is a funny guy, and for his age, I'd say he is pretty dang hot.

Sharpless is the man... He made a weekly two hour seminar completely bearable. I had him for an advanced senior seminar, so there was quite a bit of work and reading, but it was all relevant and interesting. Strikes the perfect balance with learning and being entertaining.

This guy is the man. He makes lectures very bearable and even entertaining at times. The stories he tells and tangents he goes off on are hysterical. The class is pretty general. If you attend lectures and read at least part of the novels assigned, you'll do just fine. Best professor I've ever had by far!

Sharpless gives interesting/ entertaining lectures. Didn't learn much, but an easy A. Lots of readings, but you can get away with skipping some and skimming others. Midterm/final questions given early in semester, so start preparing early and they should be easy. "Thinkpiece" essays (there were two) weren't too difficult either.
Easy class. Sharpless is super entertaining. The TA's were helpful, too. I never read the text and usually skimmed over the weekly readings and still ended up with an A.

Even if you have a mild interest in history, or history is your major, SHAPLESS is a must! if you get the right TA, go to lectures, you'll be just fine.He is a funny guy and knows his material really well.  He gives out the midterm/final questions way ahead of time.

One of the biggest bros you will ever have as a professor. Go to lecture. Not necessarily for the material, but for the stand up routine performed daily. The readings are excellent and exams are fair and interesting to write about, especially considering you get the questions to all midterms and the final about a month into the class. Bro.

Sharpless has a gross sense of humor, but he's reasonable and understanding. He hands out the midterm/final questions way ahead of time, and the readings weren't hard. I took his summer course and he was really nice. We had two in-class exams, a book review, and one lecture quiz. Good class to take and he is easy to talk to.

While entertaining and not to difficult of a class, Sharpless is a pretty mediocre prof. He took 3 lectures to talk about movies and TV which is why we never got passed Reagan. The workload is manageble one presentaion an in class essay midterm (prompt provied before)takehome essay midterm and final. Sharpless is OK but its not a bad hist course.

This guy blew his nose into his briefcase during lecture. You most likely won't get past the 1980s, but regardless you'll be entertained. Exams/papers are fair and not that difficult (you get the prompts WELL ahead of time). Sharpless is the man!

Probably the funniest man to ever walk the earth. Going to lecture is informative and entertaining at the same time. Lecture topics can be random and long winded at times, but exams are alright and he prepares you well for them. The man walks into class with a trench coat and aviator sunglasses...he knows whats up

He once told this annoying girl to hold her water LOL This man is the funniest professor I've ever had he made things clear i wouldn't say easy but if u put in the work its not hard to get a good grade. GO TO LECTURE he sometimes gives quizzes just to check if ppl are there so go ull thank yourself sharpless is the bomb
Sharpless is the man, talks bout losing his election by 1/2%, whiskey, guns, sex, n sometimes history.  doesnt care bout grades. hilarious.  however, TAs r terrible, grade very harshly.
the best professor i have had yet.  super interesting. loved the class

Really funny guy.  He makes a lot of jokes throughout lecture and is really a nice guy.  However, his lectures get really boring, and often he'll talk about a topic too long to keep you interested.  The midterms are all essays.  It's not a hard class if you know what you're going to write for your essays.

Very interesting to say the least.  Lectures are boaring, but go and take notes.  He gives you the essay exam questions way in advance, so you know what you need to do.  You read a lot in this class, always a couple chapters out of the textbook then novels on the side.  Hope that you get a good TA cause they will help you through a lot of the stuff

LOVED LOVED LOVED sharpless!!!!!  I went to his class just because he entertained me but I learned a ton!  Although some may find him unorganized, it doesn't matter.  He can do lectures off the top of his head.  He has a republican background but doesn't ram his thoughts into your heads like his fellow liberal professors. Readings are interesting

He's an interesting man.  Throws in a lot of examples that are college-student friendly.  Hard class, lots of reading, a novel every-other week + textbook chapters + supplemental radio programs.  I think he may be harder online than in class.  Do not sign up for it online just because you think it will be easy because it is NOT easy by any means.

If you prepare for the exams, which were takehome 2/3 for this past semester, then you will breeze through this class.  I have heard some of the TA's are tough graders, but the good ones help you formulate your essays.  Get Tronnes, + shes hot...
Enlightening speaker---complelling even during his (many) digressions. Leaves every class on cliffhanger. Hilarious and insightful dude.

This class is extremely easy, but lectures are painfully boring. Sharpless often seems unprepared and unenthused to teach. He takes forever to start lecture & doesn't know how to use a powerpoint. He also seems to be preverted, which is awkward, coming from an old man...

Entertaining but not enlightening.  He spends most of his time trying to be popular, and even though he loves to talk little gets said.  A friendly guy and knows the material, but transmitting that knowledge is not high on the agenda.  Main reason he's popular is that the class is an easy A.  Fun, but not for serious students.

Somewhat outspoken (I liked it, some may not).  Very funny and entertaining, and all exam questions are given out at the beginning of the term.  One 2-essay midterm, one paper, one 2-essay final.  I really enjoyed listening to him lecture, but he fell waaaay behind.  1945 to present was the goal; it became 1935 to 1980.

Not bad at all.  He gives interesting lectures.  He is a bit of a blow-hard, though.  Some of his political ideas (he ran for office in Madison years ago) are absurd.  I lost a some repsect for him after having some discussions on crime and punishment with him.  He said some things that made me believe he is not all that bright.

He gives you all of the exam questions for the semester verbatum.  However, since he gives you the questions a head of time he grades really hard on the tests.  All of the tests are blue book essays.  There is a lot of reading in this class.  His lectures are interesting but he is always on a tangent and never really on topic.
Pretty good prof, but his jokes get old quickly

Prof. Sharpless is pointless.  He panders to the students, though often clumsily.  He has verbal facility but seems frequently seems ill-prepared or bored.  His opinions are windy and important, and he's empty as a well.  You can hear the wind blow, if you know what I mean.
Outstanding professor.  A model on how to lead good discusssions and short lectures in seminar.  Lots of reading and papers due every week, which really made me focus on time management skills.
best professor ever
A lot of work but probably the most interesting professor to listen to. I took my history seminar with him. LOTS of reading but well worth it.

Takes amazingly boring topics and makes them intersting to listen to. Most entertaining professor I have ever had. Makes material fun to learn about by using humor. Very easy exams. Give out questions in advance. It's a class I look forward to every time.
This guy is awesome....if you need a history course, take his now!  He is funny as hell and very intelligent.  My favorite professor by far!
Hilarious, a lot of fun to listen to.  Sometimes lectures are boring but overall the best prof. ive had here
He is the most entertaining professor to listen to in lecture with his random tangents, but he still includes a lot of useful information. You can tell he is a very smart man.
funny, yet boring lectures
The guy is freaking hilarious! Not only does he make lecture interesting and fun, but he really knows his stuff. Very smart and very funny.
He is really funny and very bright! He gives the midterm and final questions out before the tests which makes them not that bad at all. He made class fun.
He was such a fun lecturer. He actually made me want to go to class! I loved his humor that he brought to class.
I took 2 of his classes in the early 1990's while I was working on my degree in education.  He became my model on how to be a GREAT lecturer.  Fascinating from start to finish.
This guy is a riot.
